text:
Hello helpful friends :wave::wave::wave:

*Question*: Using OAuth, is there a way to fetch only the deals that the current logged in user owns:question:


I have been trying to find an answer for this.
In general, I do not know how to get 'current logged in user' data (name, email, user id) from HubSpot using oauth api..
Thanks in advance :pray:
<@UATE4ATHP> hey, im trying to implement infinite scroll on my blog listing page but can't find anything. can you please tell me how did you implemented it?
Hi,

We are trying to add contacts to a campaign via API. While we have access to the "Add contacts to list" API, we are not able to figure out which list the campaign is associated to? Is there any solution to this?

Hi team, how are you? :wave: I am looking for more information about integration Outbrain campaign data into HubSpot via an API?

To give little context: We would like to have all the ads metrics in the same workspace to be able to track the performance and costs of our campaigns. After investigating, we have seen HubSpot avails the option of integrate all the tools except Outbrain. After talking with Jacob, one of your colleages, he told me we can integrate Outbrain campaign data into HubSpot via API with developers help.

Could someone pls confirm if this can be done or maybe of someone have experience integrating Outbrain that way? Or maybe you gius know a better way to send this data

Thank you in advance! :pray:
<@U01T4LC601X> this was for infinite scroll on my blog post page. I can't remember how it worked by I did find the code for this, if it helps

Hi team, just working on a new v4 api integration and noticed the following:

The `GET /crm/v4/objects/{objectType}/{objectId}/associations/{toObjectType}` API isn't specific enough to just get the association labels between just one particular objectType/objectId to another objectType/objectId.

Is there planned support for something like  `GET /crm/v4/objects/{objectType}/{objectId}/associations/{toObjectType}/{toObjectId}`?

Thanks!

Is there a place where a lot of the HubSpot API parameters are defined all in one place?

For example, I am thinking about Contact Property types, field_types, options.

I feel like I spend far too much time looking at the API client source code, and looking at instructions online that seems to be more tailered for someone using the web dashboard and not the API

Hi.
I would like to see File usage using the api, but cannot find anything about it in the doc and it's not in the data from file GET endpoint (api v3). Is there a way to do it ?

For example:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties>
This is helpful mostly, but then I attempt to create a Property:
```HTTP response body: {"status":"error","message":"Property 'property_name' has no options but options are required!```
And options are not defined on this page
`"options": "list[OptionInput]",`

Figured it out...
```from HubSpot.crm.schemas.models import OptionInput```

Hello fellow HubSpot devs :wave:

I'm using a Zapier "Custom Request" action to *update* a HubSpot *custom object* with the *PATCH* method as instructed by <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects|HubSpot's CRM Custom Object API docs> but for some reason HubSpot is returning a *405 Method Not Allowed* error (screenshot attached) - is it possible I need to use POST and the docs are not correct?

<@U7SL518D6> I've noticed you answered similar questions about 405s - any ideas would be greatly appreciated!

:thinking_face:
patch is correct.
fwiw, i am also getting this error in zapier.  It works fine with postman
<@U021JKWA1GB> :wave-yeti:
not sure why i always yell at you for zapier stuff
BUT
have you ever tried using zapier with a CO?

Thanks <@UD53A9UUR>
Im dropping a reminder on this. ill get back to both of you this evening!
thank you!
Is there a payments api? I can’t seem to find any docs on this.

Hey <@UFL9XN2DQ> 

This might be a long shot but that “p” makes me think that you’ve inserted the fully qualified name and not the object type id. 

Aside from that I'd use something like requestbin to see the static version of your request. Actually learned that from <@UD53A9UUR> recently!
